statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ 5 \\ -2 \\ 4 \\ 5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -1 \\ -6 \\ -6 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -1 \\ 5 \\ -5 \\ 5 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 6 \\ 4 \\ 10 \\ 9 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ -2 \\ 4 \\ -4 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent or linearly independent.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ 5 \\ -2 \\ 4 \\ 5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -1 \\ -6 \\ -6 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -1 \\ 5 \\ -5 \\ 5 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 6 \\ 4 \\ 10 \\ 9 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ -2 \\ 4 \\ -4 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent .
